acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 24-hour EC50 = 8.3mg/L for crustaceans (Daphnia magna) (SIDS, 2003), the substance was classified into Category 2.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 > 20000mg/kg (SIDS (2001)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The documented LC50 of > 2.529mg/L (SIDS (2001)) failed to specify an appropriate category, thus, classification is not possible.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Of the rat LD50 values of 1838mg/kg (female) and 3560mg/kg (male) (SIDS (2001)) documented, the female value, which is the lower of the two, was used for the basis to classify the substance into Category 4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its classification for acute toxicity is Category 2 and it is not rapidly degradable (non-biodegradable, degradability: 0% (SIDS, 2003)), 72-hour NOEC is >= 100mg/L (SIDS, 2003) for algae (Pseudokirchneriella subcapitata) (SIDS, 2003). Based on the information, the substance was classified into "Not classified".

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: The substance is solid with its melting point at 69-71degC (CERI 2006). Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Although oxygen balance data are available (-196.9), there are no data on exothermic decomposition energy. Thus, classification is not possible.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative results obtained from micronucleus tests in which mice underwent intraperitoneal administration (SIDS (2001)) and tests conducted by Bayer in 1993 and Monsant in 1989 (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified into "Not classified". Also, reverse mutation tests using microorganisms yielded negative results (SIDS (2001)). Regarding the positive results obtained from chromosomal aberration tests using CHL/IU (SIDS (2001)), cytotoxicity was extremely high and the data has little biological significance.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Since its autoignition point is 521degC, the substance does not ignite spontaneously at room temperature.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In Combined Repeated Dose Toxicity Study with the Reproduction/Developmental Toxicity Screening Tests using rats (exposure period of approx. 9 weeks), high doses were associated with decreased litter size, decreased offspring survival rate at 4 days after birth, and increased offspring mortality, which were statistically significant. In the same tests, general toxicity, such as decreased body weight and clinical symptoms, were observed in parental animals (SIDS (2002)). Therefore, the substance was classified into Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Melting point: 69-71degC (CERI 2006). Since the substance is solid with its melting point <= 140degC, the current testing method is not applicable.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In the Draize Test using rabbits, the substance was found to be slightly irritating (SIDS (2001)). Thus, it was classified into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In the 24-hour Draize Test in which the substance was applied to rabbit skin, the substance was found to be not irritating (SIDS (2001)). Thus, it was classified into "Not classified".

skin_sensitizer.rationale: In both the maximizing test in guinea pigs (SIDS (2001)) and patch test in humans (SIDS (2001)), the substance was found to be not sensitizing. Thus it was classified into "Not classified".

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In Combined Repeated Dose Toxicity Study with the Reproduction/Developmental Toxicity Screening Tests using rats (exposure period of approx. 9 weeks), no effects of the substance were observed except for decreased body weight gain at a high dose administration (450mg/kg/day) (SIDS (2001)). In addition, in 28-day inhalation tests using male rats, no adverse effects were observed other than subtle changes in blood parameters such as increased methemoglobin at a high dose administration (90mg/m3) (SIDS (2001)). Despite these results, classification is not possible due to insufficient data: the only species tested was rats, only screening tests were performed, and only male rats were used.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classification is not possible because doses that were associated with observed symptoms in oral route and inhalation exposure tests using rats (SIDS (2001), HSDB (2008)) were not provided.
